instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 no backlight
threads.message:
PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT=25V
BKL_EN=3,112V
i change before Q9706 because PPBUS_SW_LCDBKLT_PWR=0 now it's 12V

threads.title: 820-3115 no backlight
threads.message: Check voltages on BKL_PWM and SMC_LID.

threads.title: 820-3115 no backlight
threads.message: Do a PRAM reset, PWM is too low.

threads.title: 820-3115 no backlight
threads.message:
i can't, it's strange today i can't start the board, i push on button the led white in front light but no sound of superdrive, no boot i don't understand, fan spin always.
what is need for a board make a boot?

threads.title: 820-3115 no backlight
threads.message:
what is need for a board make a boot?

A whole lot!

CPU Vcore still present?

threads.title: 820-3115 no backlight
threads.message:
ok i understand.
i find Q9706 pin 3,4 in short with the other pin, not to GND. i remove Q9706 but same problem.
PPVCORE_S0_CPU = 1,159V

threads.title: 820-3115 no backlight
threads.message: Q9706 has nothing to do with the board booting. It can be anything that you damaged while working on the backlight, I have no way to tell.
